website_summaries.verdict: While these bottle brushes won't work for all needs, they are strong and capable of cleaning tough food in small, narrow bottles. The recognizable manufacturer is a plus.
pros: Narrow design makes these bottle brushes perfect for small bottles, some straws, and other tight spaces
Durable for their size, and they will hold up to repeated use
Bristles have been treated to prevent mold, mildew, and bacteria buildup
cons: Can scratch some surfaces and finishes
Not ideal for tall bottles or large containers like pitchers or jars

customer_reviews.title: Lysol Straw Brush is a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Best value in straw brushes. An absolute necessity if you enjoy your drinks through a straw like I do. If the price stays the same, I'm ordering another set. They are not the cheap kind that re-usable straws come with [thin gauge wire], these straw brushes are beefy but can be used on the narrowest of straws I have a set of over-sized glass straws and the thin stainless steel kind and this straw brush works equally well with both.
customer_reviews.author: OJ

customer_reviews.title: Limited use
customer_reviews.text: This brush is a little large in diameter for most straws. The brushes are stiff so it is hard to insert in some straws. It works best on the clear hard, non-bendable straws. In the more opaque bendable straws it gets stuck, but since it is spiral, you can "screw" it in and out. A little more time consuming. I don't believe this would work on "regular" size straws.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hoeweler

customer_reviews.title: Great bristles
customer_reviews.text: These are very hefty and would work great for regular straws or metal straws. I bought them to clean straw sippy cups and sometimes they fit and other times that are too big. Great product nonetheless even though it doesn't always suite my needs. Update 1/28/2019 So after using these for a bit I find I hate them. I wish I could love them but they just don't work for my purpose. There is only 1 sippy cup straw I can use them with and I can't even clean the lid portion of it because the cleaner is too big. I reach for my old ones 9 times out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: O'Doherty FamilyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Grinder Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I got these to clean out my electric coffee grinder. I took a pair of pliers and bent the tip of it so it would fit into the hole the coffee grounds exits out of because that area clogs up easily. And it worked!
customer_reviews.author: linen53

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like these straw brushes
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to use this in the type of straws that go in kids drink containers. Was VERY hard to get out once it was in to clean. I don't know if it was just to big or didn't like the straw material or what. Didn't work for what I wanted. I'm returning these and going to order the munchkin brand straw brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cleaning reusable straws. These are very sturdy, and the handle is easy to grip. Much better than the cheap ones you can buy for about the same price. I have only used this for plastic straws, it would be great for metal straws too, not sure if it would work on silicon straws. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star straw brush
customer_reviews.text: I feel confident washing my straws with this brush. Well made. I can tell these will last longer than other brands since they are well made, sturdy and withstand the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: SoBayBeachGirl

customer_reviews.title: Smart & Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use straws to drink daily fruit with protien powder smoothies. They are thick drinks but I had a hard time keeping my straws clean and sanitized. Now I don't. My combo is a thick plastic tall straw that fits snugly through the hole of the lid on my 30 oz stainless steel tumbler made by Ozark Trail, a perfect match. I've recommended this straw cleaner to several people and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper SD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item for cleaning straws.

I do with they were a touch longer so that you could clean a venti sized straw in one go, but this is a minor complaint. The previous straw brushes that I had were far more flimsy, and ended up being bent. These ones will stay straight.
customer_reviews.author: Zella

customer_reviews.title: Metal straw and small bottle brushes
customer_reviews.text: No compensation for this review! These brushes are durable and well made. I use to clean bent metal straws (NOT because plastic straws are outlawed where I live either I might add) and these are much better than the ones that came with the mug and straw. Lysol 57112 Straw & Bottle Brush, 4 Pack, are slightly oversized, acceptable, and loaded with bristles. Does not like the slight bend in the straw but that is why the straws are open from both ends. Good positive to grip handle on these, too. Only problem is with a 4 pack I have enough for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: G in SC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very effective!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Love how long the bristles are, and the handle is great for really getting a grip to move it around inside the straws. In the past I've used the longer, skinny straw cleaners that are solid wire handle and they're much harder to maneuver, and easily lost because of their slim profile and white bristles. These are easy to spot on the counter and easy to handle. Would certainly buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Momma

customer_reviews.title: Works for most straws? False—pass if your straws aren’t larger than standard straws .
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a waste for me. These are too big for regular straws. If you have large straws, go for it. They’re very sturdy. We have two massive sets of straws: one is plastic and one is stainless steel. I cannot get these brushes in the plastic ones at all. I can cram them in enough to clean about 80% of the metal ones, by working from both ends. I’m just going to buy more like the first two straw brushes I had. The large middle part of the brush makes these a nuisance to use.
customer_reviews.author: T Grif

customer_reviews.title: so it's not easy to move them around in the straw or pull ...

This one is very well made, but the brushes are too thick and strong, so it's not easy to move them around in the straw or pull them out. Guess I'm back to the old cheaper brushes.

product_meta.title: Quickie Full Length Straw Brushes (4 Pack) (2054872)
product_meta.description: This Quickie 4-pack of full length straw cleaning brushes is great for cleaning out water bottle straws, travel mugs, sippy cups, and more! protection reduces growth of odor causing bacteria, mold and mildew. These straws are dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: Great for thoroughly cleaning small spaces of straws and bottles
Bristles have treatment built in to protect against the bacteria, mold and Mildew
